meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Clinton Guiding Talks Israeli and Palestinian officials said negotiators working under President Clinton's supervision were trying to draft a working agreement that would highlight points of accord and unresolved issues.

Clinton Guiding Talks Israeli and Palestinian officials said negotiators working under President Clinton's supervision were trying to draft a working agreement that would highlight points of accord and unresolved issues.

Replacement for Senator The former Georgia Gov. Zell Miller, a Democrat, was chosen to succeed the late Senator Paul Coverdell, a Republican, changing the partisan political calculus in the state and in Washington.

Ulster Guerrilla Released A Protestant guerrilla who had killed mourners at an Irish Republican Army funeral in 1988 was released from prison, starting the final wave of early releases under the Ulster peace agreement.

Ticket Agents Charged Seven ticket agents for the Yankees and one for the Mets have been indicted on charges that they capitalized on a huge demand for tickets by diverting blocks of them to scalpers in return for bribes.
